alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 2:18PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 215 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Pridham Creek, Ash Creek, Stanford Creek Cottonwood Canyon and Turkey Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Cochise County along and just west of the Chiricahua Mountains. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
